description: 25 medical claim pairs: factually correct vs factually incorrect versions
source: Curated medical knowledge for out-of-domain validation

pairs.true: The human heart has four chambers.
pairs.false: The human heart has three chambers.

pairs.true: The liver is the largest internal organ in the human body.
pairs.false: The kidney is the largest internal organ in the human body.

pairs.true: Red blood cells carry oxygen throughout the body.
pairs.false: Red blood cells carry carbon dioxide throughout the body.

pairs.true: The human body has 206 bones in adulthood.
pairs.false: The human body has 150 bones in adulthood.

pairs.true: Insulin is produced by the pancreas.
pairs.false: Insulin is produced by the liver.

pairs.true: The femur is the longest bone in the human body.
pairs.false: The humerus is the longest bone in the human body.

pairs.true: Aspirin reduces inflammation and relieves pain.
pairs.false: Aspirin increases inflammation and relieves pain.

pairs.true: Penicillin is used to treat bacterial infections.
pairs.false: Penicillin is used to treat viral infections.

pairs.true: Antihistamines are used to treat allergic reactions.
pairs.false: Antihistamines are used to treat bacterial infections.

pairs.true: Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune disease.
pairs.false: Type 1 diabetes is caused by eating too much sugar.

pairs.true: Malaria is transmitted by mosquitoes.
pairs.false: Malaria is transmitted by houseflies.

pairs.true: HIV attacks the immune system by targeting CD4 cells.
pairs.false: HIV attacks the immune system by targeting red blood cells.

pairs.true: Tuberculosis is caused by bacteria.
pairs.false: Tuberculosis is caused by a virus.

pairs.true: Scurvy is caused by vitamin C deficiency.
pairs.false: Scurvy is caused by vitamin D deficiency.

pairs.true: Rabies is transmitted through animal bites.
pairs.false: Rabies is transmitted through contaminated water.

pairs.true: Vaccines work by stimulating the immune system to produce antibodies.
pairs.false: Vaccines work by directly killing pathogens in the bloodstream.

pairs.true: Handwashing reduces the spread of infectious diseases.
pairs.false: Handwashing has no effect on the spread of infectious diseases.

pairs.true: Smoking increases the risk of lung cancer.
pairs.false: Smoking decreases the risk of lung cancer.

pairs.true: Excessive alcohol consumption damages the liver.
pairs.false: Excessive alcohol consumption strengthens the liver.

pairs.true: Vitamin D can be synthesized by the skin when exposed to sunlight.
pairs.false: Vitamin D can only be obtained through diet.

pairs.true: Iron deficiency can cause anemia.
pairs.false: Iron deficiency can cause diabetes.

pairs.true: The brain uses approximately 20 percent of the body's energy.
pairs.false: The brain uses approximately 5 percent of the body's energy.

pairs.true: Neurons communicate through electrical and chemical signals.
pairs.false: Neurons communicate only through electrical signals.

pairs.true: DNA is a double helix structure.
pairs.false: DNA is a single-stranded structure.

pairs.true: Humans typically have 23 pairs of chromosomes.
pairs.false: Humans typically have 30 pairs of chromosomes.
